title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
Hi guys iam new here . In the past i fixt a lot of old mackbook  airs 2008-2009 made a money with it. After a few airs that i cannot fix i look closer and start learning and watching day in day out louis his youtube channel.i bought a macbook pro with no backlight to start learning 
i start looking at the schematics for this model 820-2936
i got 12,6 dc on F9700 it was the first thing a put my fluke on
i got nothing on c9796 olso 
can you guys tell me what to look for 
it has no waterdamage
greetings triple6r

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
12V on F9700 is not enough info. You should measure if 12V is on both sides to make sure it is not blown. 
Is there an image on the LCD? Was this liquid?

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
Hi pin 1 from F9700 is 12.60 and on pin 2 4.330? 
Yess there is an image. No no liquid 
thnxs

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: So the fuse is blown. This happend because of a short on the backlight output. Measure resistance to GND on C9796.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Hi i measure it and it go's from 0,640 slowy upward 0,644 06.48 and more

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: someone probably blew the fuse, carefully insepct the screen cable and connector, if nothing seems wrong replace f97000 and see what happens

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Hm i have put other screen on it and same problem and i put a light on de back of the screen and go to webcam and that olso not working?

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Replace the fuse and see if backlight works.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I did replace it it got backlight now but nou only got white screen it start up it chaims i here donggg ?? Did i hit something with replacing the fuse

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Hold down the ALT key while turning it on. Disconnect any HDD. Do you get a boot menu? If not what is the voltage on C9015?

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Hi i have done the alt key etc dont work. I have 0 on c9015 pin 1

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: So no power to the LCD. I bet L9004 is fried. Check for a short on C9015 first before replacing it of course. LCD plugged in!

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I see that i got a strange looking L9004 ? Can that be the problem but how can that be before i got image no backlight now i got backlight no image

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Same time haha

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I got 0.9m ohms

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: 0.9m as in milli or Mega? If low then unplug LCD and see if short is gone. Inspect cable/connector for damage.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I unplugd lcd cable now i getting 2,043 k ohms before mine fluke on same mode 0,9 m ohms

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
sounds like you are measuring to GND and not measuring across the suspect component.

Measure across pin 1 and 2 of the component

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
I got when i measure across pin 1 and 2 with lcd cable 4.216 k ohms (c9015)
and with no lcd cable plugd 204.4 k ohms

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: the components bad then, replace it, it should restore the diaply

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: So if you plug in the cable there is a short. Inspect the cable and connector for damage. I suspect a bad cable.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I changed cable i got on c9015 4.206 k ohms and on 8.38 k ohms on L9004 both measured across

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
Soo i was taking of L9004 and one of the pads totaly gone burnd of stuck under l9004 so iam thinking that i need to run a wire to fix this i have order wire its coming next week 

i took off l9004 and put on new other one but nothing olso the screen is totaly black now so i think i have to wait for the wire

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Without L9004 there should be a white screen with backlight. So if there is nothing now the screen is not recognized. Either bad cable or something got damaged. C9010 3V present? Check if cable properly plugged in and try with the old cable to see if backlight comes back.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I got on c9010 pin 2 3v i got on pin 1 nothing (goes to gnd)

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: No idea, should at least have backlight/image. Test with the old cable and see if anything changes. Or did you blow the fuse again?

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
Hi i checkt the cable and cable is bad 1 pin was twisted so i have order new cables i have to wait for that all my other cables ar olso bad ... but i have still nothing on c9015 no volt 
and i have still repair L9004 the path under it is gone ??

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Wait for a good cable and try again. First need backlight back again. Then also check if 3V gets to C9011.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: hi so i got new cables and no backlight no screen and also nothing on c9011? F9700 12.53

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: Use a known good display assembly.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: hi i try the screen on a 820-3115-b and it works on that board

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: First check pins 1-7 of they have continuity to the LCD to ensure connector/cable are good. Then check if LCD_IG_PWR_EN  comes high with the screen connected.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: pin 1 0 pin 2 0 pin 3 0 pin 4 3,307 pin 5 1.5 pin 6 3,3 pin 7 3,3

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: and lcd_ig_power_en r9014pin 1 0 pin 2 nothing u9000 pin 1 0

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message:
I have no idea what you are doing. I just asked if there was continuity from pins 1-7 on the LCD connector to the end of a separate cable. 

You can also measure diode mode on pins 1-7  on the end of the LCD cable.

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: i did diode mode now and got a lot of different measurements

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: It was jumping from 100-30-221 on the end 2.2 m ohms

title: 820-2936-B No backlight
message: I can't help you if you do not know how to use a multimeter. I hope you are not measuring this when powered on at least.
